title: How do construction consultancy firm works? What is their job? - Quora

response.answer_text: Working in construction trades my entire life, it has been my experience with every single construction consultancy company, that all they are good for are these things:1. To add another level of difficulty in obtaining an answer for a question2. To take up precious jobsite space with a trailer they can sit in and look busy without actually doing anything.3. To keep all blueprint revisions a secret from everyone possible as long as possible4. To come up with ridiculous and the most labor intensive solution to logistical and construction issues5. To schedule subcontractors of various trades and building department inspections haphazardly so trades are not on the project at the optimal time or in the optimal order for efficient progress, and instead creating a clusterfuck where different trades are waiting on each other or are on top of each other and also limiting available resources such as site space, and creating a situation where trades are fighting over access to electricity and water. And so building officials are called in to the site to perform inspections before the work is ready for inspection.6. To delay the progress of construction (see 1,2,3,4,&5 above)7. To increase the cost of a project due to their exorbitant fees and the delays they cause (see 1,2,3,4,5,&6 above)8. To blame every contractor and material supplier associated with the project for delays in construction and increased costs (see 1,2,3,4,5,6,&7 above)9. To direct the contractors how to hide the mistakes caused by the consulting firm from building officials10. To walk around once a day making sure everyone is wearing a hard hat That is literally, all that construction consultants are good for. They might help with some pencil pushing off site, I don't know. If they do, it doesn't justify the headaches and cost increases they cause by being onsite. If you have a good general contractor with a decent site superintendent working fom him, you don't need a consulting firm. Period.

First of all let me brief the stages involved in major construction projects Generally construction works will happen in 3 Phases 1. Pre Construction Stage 2. Construction Stage 3. Post Construction Stage Pre Construction Stage: Preliminary cost estimation /DPR will prepared; it will be based on the available detailsGetting Statuary ApprovalsMajor Surveying works i.e. Land, Geo Tech SurveyingSchedules will be prepared i.e Master schedule, schedule for Tender, Design etcDesign i.e. Concept Design, DBR/ Detailed Design/ Drawings & Documents for Architectural, Structural, MEP (Mechanical, Electrical and Plumbing) Designs, HVAC, Interior, Façade, Landscaping etc. list will go onBudgeting (it will updated as and when design get updated)BOQ (Bill of Quantities will be prepared)Procurement of activities – which involves shortlisiting of vendors, floating tenders, evaluation, selecting the right vendorsConstruction Stage or Phase Once the major procurement activities done, Construction will commence at siteProject Management Consultants will ensure effective construction management in various areas like Work Progress, Change Order Management, Quantity & Bill Checking and Quality supported by respective Technical Specialists from Engineering Design Consultant Team.Post Construction Stage or Phase Closure of ProjectConsultants will assist contract closure and along with material reconciliation, proper documentation for handover.Consultants shall prepare punch lists for proper closure of project activities.Consultants shall assist in release of completion certificates.Consultants will quantify the financial impact, loss of profit and related aspects, red flag the concerned issues to all stakeholders.Major consultant who play vital role in the construction projects are as follows Architect (Local & International)Project Management ConsultantStructural Design ConsultantMEP Design ConsultantInterior Design ConsultantLandscape, Façade ConsultantQS & Cost ConsultantNow let us know, what is the role construction consultant i.e. Project Managements and Cost Consultant Role of a Project Management Consultancy in brief Project Management Project Execution Strategy Development Project Planning & Schedule Management Project Coordination, Procurement Assistance Project Cost Management Design Coordination & Control; Construction Management till Project Closure Construction Monitoring Quality Monitoring Bill Checking Safety Monitoring Project Closure & Handover As per recent development, most of the major firms separate cost management from project management and they hire an independent cost consultant, which result in more transferency, good control over the cost and helps client in completing the project within the budget and on time. Now let us look into the role of Cost Consultant Preconstruction Cost planning/cash flow forecasts Preparation of BOQ’s Rate Analysis Assist client in procurement stage Construction phase Continuous project cost monitoring Change order management Detailed monthly cost report Material Reconciliation RA Bill Checking / Certification Project closeout Final bills certifications Final reconciliation of materials. Final closure report on the project.
